DataElement.preferredName: Person Follicular Lymphoma Staging Eligibility Determination Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the Follicular Lymphoma International Prognostic Index (FLIPI Score) and Groupe d'Etude des Lymphomes Folliculaires (GELF) staging criteria for lymphoma to determine the eligibility of a patient to participate on a clinical trial for the treatment follicular lymphoma, a neoplasm of follicle centre B cells which has at least a partial follicular pattern.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Follicular Lymphoma Staging Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the eligibility of a patient to participate on a clinical trial for the treatment follicular lymphoma, a neoplasm of follicle centre B cells which has at least a partial follicular pattern, using the Follicular Lymphoma International Prognostic Index (FLIPI Score) and Groupe d'Etude des Lymphomes Folliculaires (GELF) criteria.

Property.preferredDefinition: A neoplasm of follicle centre B cells which has at least a partial follicular pattern.  Follicular lymphomas comprise about 35% of adult non-Hodgkin's lymphomas in the U.S. and 22% worldwide.  Most patients have widespread disease at diagnosis.  Morphologically, follicular lymphomas are classified as Grade 1, Grade 2, and Grade 3, depending on the percentage of the large lymphocytes present.  The vast majority of cases (70-95%) express the BCL-2 rearrangement [t(14;18)].  Histological grade correlates with prognosis.  Grades 1 and 2 follicular lymphomas are indolent and grade 3 is more aggressive (adapted from WHO, 2001). -- 2003:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm of follicle centre B cells which has at least a partial follicular pattern.  Follicular lymphomas comprise about 35% of adult non-Hodgkin lymphomas in the U.S. and 22% worldwide.  Most patients have widespread disease at diagnosis.  Morphologically, follicular lymphomas are classified as Grade 1, Grade 2, and Grade 3, depending on the percentage of the large lymphocytes present.  The vast majority of cases (70-95%) express the BCL-2 rearrangement [t(14;18)].  Histological grade correlates with prognosis.  Grades 1 and 2 follicular lymphomas are indolent and grade 3 is more aggressive (adapted from WHO, 2001).
The process of defining at what point in the natural history of a malignant disease a patient is when a diagnosis is made.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the lymphoma staging condition or state at a particular time.
